cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving NNE toward Florida Big Bend, then expected to sweep NE across southern Georgia and hug the Southeast U.S. coastline toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Suwannee River–Mexico Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet NC, including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County line FL northward to Surf City NC (includes entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through Georgia and South Carolina coasts and northward into the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (≥39 mph) likely Friday with gusts possibly approaching 50–60 mph as the center passes inland just west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals, creating risk of flash flooding in the Savannah area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible Friday; brief coastal inundation could affect low-lying terminals.
